com.xhive.xpath.interfaces
Interface XhiveXPathContextIf

public interface XhiveXPathContextIf

Context that can be used by both XPath and XPointer queries. The context can be used to supply namespace, variable and functions bindings than can be referenced by the query. The context object also represents the absolute root the query should obey to. The absolute root is initialized when the context is created to the node the context is created on. Contexts an be created using the createXPathContext method on XhiveNodeIf. Contexts can not be used anymore after a transaction end! The reason for this is that the context can point to data that has become invalid, since after a transaction end changes of other sessions will also become visible. If the context is after a transaction end an XhiveException.INVALID_CONTEXT will be thrown. (c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
3.0
See Also:
XhiveNodeIf.createXPathContext()

Method Detail

addNamespaceBinding

void addNamespaceBinding(java.lang.String prefix,
                         java.lang.String uri)
Add a namespace binding to this context

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix to bind the namespace uri to
uri - a valid namespace uri that should be bound to the prefix
Throws:
XhiveException.INVALID_CONTEXT - if the context is used after a transaction end

addFunctionBinding

void addFunctionBinding(java.lang.String methodName,
                        java.lang.String className)
Add a functionbinding to this context The method called by the functionbinding should be a static method of its class.

Parameters:
methodName - the name of the method to execute.
className - the class containing the method
Throws:
XhiveException.INVALID_CONTEXT - if the context is used after a transaction end
